sections.heading: for foreclosure or satisfaction; allegations; complainant; designate person to receive notices; when
sections.text: (1) Upon filing a complaint for the foreclosure or satisfaction of a mortgage, the complainant shall state therein whether any proceedings have been had at law for the recovery of the debt secured th

sections.heading: only to formal mortgages and not to mortgages or liens arising out of the equities between the parties
sections.text: Luikart v. Bank of Benkelman, 132 Neb. 501, 272 N.W. 324 (1937); Bankers Life Ins. Co. v. Ohrt, 131 Neb. 858, 270 N.W. 497 (1936).

sections.heading: for benefit of mortgagor, and between lienors is not required. Chaffee v. Schestedt, 4 Neb. Unof. 740, 96 N.W. 161 (1903).
